aom.scripting.ui.console

Class Unit

  • Object
    • Unit

  • public class Unit
extends Object
    This class provides a collection of Console commands concerning Units. The concept of "units" is very broad: it is not limited to just regular units. Also buildings, SFX effects etc. are included. A unit always has an ID and is of a certain protounit type.
    Author:
    Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com

      • uiBuildAtPointer

        public void uiBuildAtPointer()
        Instructs the currently selected unit(s) to build the currently active cursor protounit at the pointer location. This is typically used in game to build buildings. It is however not limited to buildings, and can be used to place units too.
        Auto Syncs
        See Also:
        uiSetProtoCursor(string, bool), uiPlaceAtPointer(bool)

      • uiPlaceAtPointer

        public void uiPlaceAtPointer(bool changeVariation)
        Places the currently active cursor protounit.
        Auto Syncs
        Editor Mode Only
        This is typically used to place units in the editor.
        See Also:
        uiSetProtoCursor(string, bool), uiBuildAtPointer()

      • uiTransformSelectedUnit

        public void uiTransformSelectedUnit(string protoName)
        Transforms the selected unit into the specified ProtoUnit.
        Auto Syncs
        This command can be used to manually transfer a series of bits to other players by converting gatherers in ulfsarks or walls in gates and back.

      • protoCount

        public int protoCount(string typeName)
        Deprecated. 
        Shows how many ProtoUnits that are alive in the scenario.
        Local Call

        Since:
        AoT
        Auto Syncs

        public void uiSummonWorkersToSelectedUnit()

      • trainByID

        public void trainByID(int protoUnitID,
                      int trainingUnitID,
                      int playerID)
        Start the training of a unit of ProtoUnitID from TrainingUnitID. If no player is specified, the current one is used.
        Auto Syncs

      • trainInSelected

        public void trainInSelected(string protoName,
                            int traincount)
        Tries to train the selected unit type in any valid selected unit.
        Auto Syncs
        Note
        No algorithm to properly distribute the production over all buildings is used.

      • tis

        public void tis(string protoName,
                int traincount)
        Just like trainInSelected, but more abbreviated.
        Auto Syncs

      • tisID

        public void tisID(int protoID,
                  int traincount)
        Just like trainInSelected, but more abbreviated because it takes a protoID.
        Auto Syncs

      • trainCancelByButtonIndex

        public void trainCancelByButtonIndex(int buttonIndex,
                                     int trainingUnitID,
                                     int playerID)
        Cancels the training of a unit from TrainingUnitID at the given index. If no player is specified, the current one is used.
        Auto Syncs

      • uiDeleteSelectedUnit

        public void uiDeleteSelectedUnit(int keyState)
        Deletes selected unit. This is the default in-game action when the delete button is pressed.
        Auto Syncs

      • uiRemoveSelectedUnit

        public void uiRemoveSelectedUnit(int unitID)
        Removes specified unit, or selected unit if not ID is specified. This is the default action in the editor when the delete button is pressed.

      • uiStopSelectedUnits

        public void uiStopSelectedUnits()
        Stop selected units.
        Auto Syncs

        Enter unbuild mode with selected building.
        Local Call

      • uiUnbuildSelectedUnitAtPointer

        public void uiUnbuildSelectedUnitAtPointer()

        Auto Syncs

        Indicates that the unit scale up key has gone up/down.
        Single Player Only

      • uiWorkAtPointer

        public void uiWorkAtPointer()
        Issues a work (e.g. walk to, empower, garrison, attack, ...) at pointer location.
        Auto Syncs

      • uiRotateSelection

        public void uiRotateSelection()
        Rotates the selected unit.
